IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: RAI PROVIDES & OPERATES NURSING AND ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES FOR THE ELDERLY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION IS ARTICULATED IN ITS ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION AS FOLLOWS:THE CORPORATION IS ORGANIZED EXCLUSIVELY FOR CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS DEFINED IN SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1986, AS AMENDED. IN FURTHERANCE OF THOSE CHARITABLE PURPOSES, THE CORPORATION SHALL BE EMPOWERED TO BUILD, LEASE, ACQUIRE AND OTHERWISE OWN AND OPERATE RESIDENTIAL FACILITIES, NURSING FACILITIES AND OTHER RELATED FACILITIES AND SERVICES FOR THE ELDERLY, MENTALLY RETARDED, MENTALLY ILL, DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED AND OTHER LIKE CONDITIONS WITHOUT REGARD TO RACE, RELIGION, COLOR, SEX, CREED OR NATIONAL ORIGIN OF SAID PERSONS. THE CORPORATION WILL NOT ENGAGE IN THE PRACTICE OF MEDICINE NOR RENDER ANY LICENSED PROFESSIONAL SERVICES.
IRS990.Desc: ALL PROGRAM SERVICES RELATE TO PROVIDING AND OPERATING SKILLED NURSING FACILITIES, HEALTH CARE, ASSISTED AND SEMI-INDEPENDENT LIVING FACILITIES, AND OTHER RELATED SERVICES TO THE ELDERLY. THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES 22 FACILITIES WITH A COMBINED TOTAL OF 1,572 BEDS WITHIN THESE FACILITIES.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: RESTRICTED CASH IN LIEU OF A SURETY BOND

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: MORTGAGE NOTE PAYABLE TO FRANCES HOUSE, INC.
INTEREST PAYABLE TO FRANCES HOUSE, INC.
RENT PAYABLE TO PERU BECKER, LTD., NFP

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTIONS 501(C)(3) OR 501(C)(2) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THEREFORE, NO PROVISION HAS BEEN MADE FOR FEDERAL OR STATE INCOME TAXES. MANAGEMENT EVALUATED THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX POSITIONS AND CONCLUDED THAT THE ORGANIZATION HAD TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE ADJUSTMENT TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS TO COMPLY WITH THE PROVISIONS OF ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES GENERALLY ACCEPTED IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA (U.S. GAAP). WITH FEW EXCEPTIONS, THE ORGANIZATION IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE FOR YEARS BEFORE 2019.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: TWO DIRECTORS COMMON TO RAI & LTC ARE J. SHAW & J. KNIERY.
BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: SUPPORT SERVICES ARE PROVIDED BY LTC SUPPORT SERVICES, LLC, AS DESCRIBED IN SCHEDULE O RELATIVE TO PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3. JEFFREY SHAW, WHO IS A DIRECTOR OF RESIDENTIAL ALTERNATIVES OF ILLINOIS, INC. AND LTC SUPPORT SERVICES, LLC, RECEIVED DIRECTOR'S FEES OF $0 FROM LTC SUPPORT SERVICES, LLC, FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING MARCH 31, 2023. JOHN KNIERY, WHO IS A DIRECTOR OF RESIDENTIAL ALTERNATIVES OF ILLINOIS, INC. AND LTC SUPPORT SERVICES, LLC, RECEIVED DIRECTOR'S FEES OF $0 FROM LTC SUPPORT SERVICES, LLC FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING MARCH 31, 2023.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVES SUPPORT SERVICES FROM LTC SUPPORT SERVICES, LLC, AN UNRELATED COMPANY. THESE SERVICES INCLUDE OVERSIGHT, TRAINING, REGULATORY COMPLIANCE, QUALITY ASSURANCE PROGRAMS, HUMAN RESOURCE SUPPORT, MARKETING AND MAINTENANCE. RESIDENTIAL ALTERNATIVES OF ILLINOIS, INC., OWNS 14.2% OF LTC SUPPORT SERVICES, LLC., AND FRANCES HOUSE, INC., (PARENT ORGANIZATION OF RESIDENTIAL ALTERNATIVES OF ILLINOIS, INC.) OWNS 14.2% OF LTC SUPPORT SERVICES, LLC. THE REMAINING 71.6% OF LTC SUPPORT SERVICES, LLC, IS OWNED BY UNRELATED EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO HAS A NEGOTIATED ARMS LENGTH ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES CONTRACT WITH RFMS, INC., AN UNRELATED COMPANY, TO OBTAIN SERVICES SUCH AS CASH MANAGEMENT, ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL REPORTING, PAYROLL AND EMPLOYEE BENEFITS, INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY, REGULATORY MATTERS, AND OTHER GENERAL BUSINESS AND FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT SERVICES AS REQUIRED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS A SUBSIDIARY OF FRANCES HOUSE, INC. FRANCES HOUSE, INC., IS THE MEMBER OF THE ORGANIZATION. FRANCES HOUSE, INC., ELECTS THE GOVERNING BODY ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECEIVES A PAPER COPY OF FORM 990 FOR THEIR REVIEW AND COMMENT PRIOR TO ITS FILING. THE BOARD ALSO REVIEWS IN DETAIL EACH FORM 990 FILED BY THE ORGANIZATION AT ITS REGULARLY SCHEDULED BOARD MEETINGS. ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, EACH BOARD MEMBER ATTENDS A TRAINING SESSION THAT PROVIDES UPDATES ON CURRENT EXEMPT ORGANIZATION TAX COMPLIANCE MATTERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL OFFICERS, DIRECTORS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO ATTEST TO THEIR COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS ALL COMPLETED CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS TO DETERMINE IF ANY CONFLICTS EXIST WHICH WOULD REQUIRE RESTRICTION ON PARTICIPATION IN THE GOVERNING BODY'S DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS IN ANY TRANSACTIONS INVOLVING THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A PAPER COPY OF FORM 990 IS PROVIDED UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990 IS ALSO AVAILABLE VIA THE GUIDESTAR.ORG WEBSITE AND THROUGH THE ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE OF THE STATE OF ILLINOIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT MAKE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC EXCEPT THROUGH PUBLIC FILING REQUIREMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, COLUMN F:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: RON WILSON IS EMPLOYED BY RFMS, INC., AN UNRELATED ORGANIZATION WHICH HAS AN ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES CONTRACT WITH RESIDENTIAL ALTERNATIVES OF ILLINOIS, INC. THE TYPE OF SERVICES PROVIDED BY RFMS, INC., ARE DETAILED IN THE SCHEDULE O EXPLANATION ABOVE RELATIVE TO FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3. RON WILSON IS THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER OF RFMS, INC. HIS COMPENSATION REPORTED ON HIS RFMS, INC. FORM W-2, BOX 5 FOR CALENDAR YEAR 2022 IS $196,536. THIS COMPENSATION AMOUNT HAS NOT BEEN PRORATED BASED ON TIME SPENT FOR EACH OF THE FIFTEEN ORGANIZATIONS TO WHOM SERVICES ARE PROVIDED BY RFMS, INC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, COLUMN B:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: APPROXIMATELY ONE HALF OF THE AVERAGE HOURS PER WEEK ESTIMATED FOR EACH DIRECTOR IS DEVOTED TO RELATED ORGANIZATIONS LISTED ON SCHEDULE R.
THE PROCESS FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AND SELECTION OF INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF RESIDENTIAL ALTERNATIVES OF ILLINOIS, INC., WERE AUDITED AS PART OF THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL REPORT ISSUED FOR FRANCES HOUSE, INC., AND SUBSIDIARIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: RESIDENTIAL ALTERNATIVES OF ILLINOIS, INC., IS A SUBSIDIARY OF FRANCES HOUSE, INC. PIONEER CONCEPTS, INC., AND PINNACLE OPPORTUNITIES, INC., ARE SUBSIDIARIES OF FRANCES HOUSE, INC. THE 501(C)(2) ORGANIZATIONS LISTED IN THIS SECTION ARE SUBSIDIARIES OF FRANCES HOUSE, INC.
